block.p: Lauren Cathleen Porcaro and Christopher S. Dorment Jr. were married yesterday at St. Benedict Roman Catholic Church in the Bronx. Msgr. Edmund J. Whalen performed the ceremony.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an editorial associate at The New Yorker magazine in Manhattan, and is a Duke graduate. She is a daughter of Ellen M. Porcaro and William C. Porcaro of the Bronx.
Lauren Cathleen Porcaro and Christopher S. Dorment Jr. were married yesterday at St. Benedict Roman Catholic Church in the Bronx. Msgr. Edmund J. Whalen performed the ceremony.
Lauren Cathleen Porcaro and Christopher S. Dorment Jr. were married yesterday at St. Benedict Roman Catholic Church in the Bronx. Msgr. Edmund J. Whalen performed the ceremony.

The bride, 32, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an editorial associate at The New Yorker magazine in Manhattan, and is a Duke graduate. She is a daughter of Ellen M. Porcaro and William C. Porcaro of the Bronx.

Her mother is the chairwoman of the math department at Preston, an all-girls private high school in the Bronx. Her father is the dean of students at Cristo Rey in East Harlem, a part of a network of Jesuit high schools working with urban teenagers.
The bridegroom, 35, is a senior sales executive at Equinix, a data center company in Foster City, Calif. He graduated from Boston College.
He is the son of Mimi P. Dorment and Christopher S. Dorment Sr., of Washington. His father is chairman and owner of Rocky Gorge Development, a residential real estate developer in McLean, Va.
